intro: Aristida jonesii, commonly known as Jones' threeawn, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, three-awned spikelets that are typical of the genus Aristida. Aristida jonesii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed or marginal areas.
